citation.article-title: Pelospora glutarica gen. nov., sp. nov., a glutarate-fermenting, strictly anaerobic, spore-forming bacterium
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Pelospora glutarica sp. nov.
Pelospora glutarica (glu.ta'ri.ca. M.L. n. glutarica referring to glutarate, from M.L. n. acidum glutaricum glutaric acid, as the key substrate of this species)
Long, rod-shaped cells, 4.5-6.5x0.8 μm in size, motile by one subpolar flagellum, Gram-negative staining, formation of terminal oval spores.
Glutarate, methylsuccinate and succinate are the only substrates.
No growth with more than 30 different substrates tested such as sugars, organic acids, alcohols, amino acids or other dicarboxylic acids.
Products of glutarate and methylsuccinate fermentation are butyrate, isobutyrate and CO2; succinate is decarboxylated to propionate.
Growth rate with glutarate at 37 °C, μ=0.062 h-1.
pH optimum for growth is 7.1-8.2; no growth below pH 6.0.
Temperature optimum 37 °C; no growth below 20 °C or above 37 °C.
Growth in medium containing salt concentrations of 0.1% NaCl and 0.04% MgCl2⋄6H2O (w/v) ; no growth in salt-water medium at 2% NaCl and 0.3% MgCl2⋄6H2O (w/v).
G+­C content of DNA of the type strain is 49.0±1.4 mol%.
The type strain, strain WoGl3T, has been deposited in the DSMZ as DSM 6652T.
